results.title: Signs of Life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Brisbane College of Advanced Education AV Prod Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Deaf Community has been an unknown and misunderstood minority group for far too long. In this lively, informative video, the stereotypes are blown away. Here we see deaf people leading normal, purposeful lives, participating in a wide range of activities which their thriving community supports and talking about their lives with inspiring candour, insight and humour.

results.title: Shows Promise: Should Go Far (Exceptional Children)
results.brief_description: A study of four exceptional children in one family, each excelling in at least one area of learning. Examines their upbringing and the key role played by their mother who has been influenced by Montessori.

results.title: Shout it out numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animated geometric shapes and music to illustrate numbers from one to ten. Triangles, circles, and squares transform into animals, trains, suns, see-saws and other familiar objects.

results.title: Shortspell
results.creator_credit: Stuart Wynn Jones and Kinetic Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: An animated review of the alphabet in which each letter becomes a picture and each picture becomes the next letter. Both sound and picture are drawn directly onto the film by the artist.

results.title: Short poppies 2
results.brief_description: Short poppies is a competitive film and video festival open to university and college students from around the world. This collection of ten productions has been selected from the second festival which opened at Kinselas night club in Sydney on July 7th 1994. The films were judged by a panel of filmmakers, critics and students and award winning work then toured around Australia to all capital cities. The short films included originate from Canada, Australia, United Kingdom and Germany, the titles of which are: “Rokadeus”, “The stranger”, “Bear in mind, “Memory snares”, “Bete noire”, “Talk show”, “Pet”, “Schlaraffenland”, “Miss Dudevant’s hand”, and “Beatrix and Marvin”.

results.title: Short history = Scurta istorie
results.creator_credit: Ion Popescu Gopo and Studioul Cinematografic Bucuresti
results.brief_description: Using animation techniques presents a complete history of mankind from the birth of the Earth, showing man as a descendant of an ape. Taking with him everywhere a symbolic flower he explores the planet, optimistically considering life under water, and eventually, life on other planets of the cosmos.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ion Popescu Gopo and Studioul Cinematografic Bucuresti

results.title: Shopping in Japan: an invitation to quality
results.brief_description: Retail traders in Japan offer a very wide range of quality consumer goods to the people of Japan and vistors to the country. These include goods made in both the traditional manner by craftsmen in home industries and in small vilalge factories, and those made in the new efficient industrial complexes.

results.title: Shoplifting: Sharon's Story
results.creator_credit: Dennis Cull, Yvonne Chotzen and Auro Productions
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a young woman who steals from a department store and is subsequently arrested. Shows her reactions and as those of her parents, to the humiliation of search, interrogation, detention, family, confrontation and court procedure.
